comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110930134335

Steps to reproduce:

I've clicked on the "Save" button in my TiddlyWiki local file; see http://www.tiddlywiki.com/ for details on this program.
The Javascript embed in the page is meant to write to disk the modification made to the html.


Actual results:

Firefox pops-up a windows asking for confirmation of executing the script which should write to disk. While it seems necessary to have such protection, the "Remember my decision" checkbox doesn't seem to work for this particular file:// case.

The box contained the following text (in french :/):
Un script provenant de « file:// » demande des fonctionnalités avancées qui sont NON SÛRES et susceptibles d'être utilisées pour compromettre votre machine ou vos données :  Exécuter ou installer des logiciels sur votre machine   Il n'est conseillé d'autoriser ces fonctionnalités que si leur provenance est connue pour être exempte de virus ou de programmes malicieux.


Expected results:

Firefox should remember my decision event for file:// cases when a script is asking to execute code that might harm the computer.

comments.text: Can you write a short test case to reproduce this easily?

comments.author: ultrag33k@gmail.com
comments.text:
Test Case:
* Download a blank TiddlyWiki at the following address: http://www.tiddlywiki.com/empty.download
* Open downloaded empty.html from you local drive in Firefox
* Modify the content of the page:
   * Click "New Tiddler" on right side of the page
   * Change the text of the New Tiddler to whatever
   * Click "done" in the uper right corner of the said tiddler
* Click "Save Changes" on the right side of the page
* You should get the warning described in the first place
* Click "Remember my decision"
* Click "Authorize"
* Modify the content of the page:
   * Click "New Tiddler" on right side of the page
   * Change the text of the New Tiddler to whatever
   * Click "done" in the uper right corner of the said tiddler

(At this time every thing should seem normal, the new modifications being written to disk without further warning.)

* Close and restart Firefox
* Reopen said file
* Modify the content of the page:
   * Click "New Tiddler" on right side of the page
   * Change the text of the New Tiddler to whatever
   * Click "done" in the uper right corner of the said tiddler
* You get the warning described in the first place hence the previous decision being ignored.

Every time you restart, reopen and modify locally saved file, the warning comes back, even if you consciously click the "Remember My Decision".

Cheers.
